H1.text: Who was the head of the German Ministry of Public Enlightenment and Propaganda from 1933 to 1945. Heinrich Himmler

H2.text: Who was the head of the German Ministry of Public Enlightenment and Propaganda from 1933 to 1945. Joseph Goebbels' brother

H3.text: Who was the head of the German Ministry of Public Enlightenment and Propaganda from 1933 to 1945. Goebles

A4.text: Goebbels received Hitler's appointment to the cabinet, becoming head of the newly created Reich Ministry of Public Enlightenment and Propaganda in March 1933.

A5.text: Goebbels was a German politician and philologist who was the Gauleiter of Berlin, chief propagandist for the Nazi Party, and then Reich Minister of Propaganda from 1933 until his suicide in 1945.

A6.text: Information about Joseph Goebbels in the Reichstag database

A7.text: Joseph Goebbels | Holocaust Encyclopedia at the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum

A8.text: The Ministry of Propaganda was headed by Goebbels, not by Heinrich Himmler.

A9.text: Goebbels controlled the wire services and insisted that all newspapers in Germany should only publish content favourable to the regime.

A10.text: Under Goebbels, the Propaganda Ministry issued two dozen directives every week on exactly what news should be published and what angles to use.
